response.raw_message_text:
{
  "risk_factors": [
    ("age", "medium", "Younger individuals, particularly males, tend to have higher recidivism rates."),
    ("gender", "high", "Males generally have a higher likelihood of reoffending compared to females."),
    ("arrest_history", "medium", "Having multiple arrests can indicate a pattern of behavior that may lead to recidivism."),
    ("marital_status", "medium", "Living alone and being unmarried can contribute to social isolation, which is a risk factor."),
    ("education", "medium", "Having only a GED and not pursuing further education may limit opportunities and increase risk."),
    ("employment_history", "medium", "Holding only 2 jobs in a year suggests instability, which can be a risk factor."),
    ("substance_use", "high", "Recent drug use, especially if frequent, is a strong predictor of recidivism."),
    ("mental_health", "high", "Feeling persistently down can indicate underlying mental health issues, which are linked to higher recidivism."),
    ("family_background", "medium", "Growing up in a household with multiple members in an urban area may expose one to higher risks."),
    ("spiritual_beliefs", "low", "Lack of belief in a higher power may not directly correlate with recidivism but can indicate a lack of support systems.")
  ],
  "prediction": "YES",
  "confidence": 75
}

risk_factors: Younger individuals, particularly males, tend to have higher recidivism rates.
Males generally have a higher likelihood of reoffending compared to females.
Having multiple arrests can indicate a pattern of behavior that may lead to recidivism.
Living alone and being unmarried can contribute to social isolation, which is a risk factor.
Having only a GED and not pursuing further education may limit opportunities and increase risk.
Holding only 2 jobs in a year suggests instability, which can be a risk factor.
Recent drug use, especially if frequent, is a strong predictor of recidivism.
Feeling persistently down can indicate underlying mental health issues, which are linked to higher recidivism.
Growing up in a household with multiple members in an urban area may expose one to higher risks.
Lack of belief in a higher power may not directly correlate with recidivism but can indicate a lack of support systems.

prompt.system:
You are a highly experienced criminal justice risk assessment expert
employing advanced statistical and judicial knowledge.
prompt.user:
You are a criminal risk assessment expert. Step back, take a deep breath and carefully think step by step to assign a relative weight [low, medium, high] to each risk factor before using them to collectively predict 3-year rearrest recidivism:
The person is a 21-year-old male who identifies himself as Black. He has been arrested 2 times but has not been convicted. He is 5 feet 11 inches and weighs between 200 and 224 lbs. He has never been married and is currently living alone. He has a GED certificate and is not enrolled in college. He has held 2 jobs during the year. He has used drugs in the past four years (marijuana) and all of the time during the past month he has felt so down in the dumps that nothing could cheer him up. At a young age, he lived with his biological mother in a household of size 4, in an urban area. He considers that God has nothing to do with what happens to him personally.

After your analysis, you must respond ONLY with a JSON object in exactly this format, with no additional text:

{
  "risk_factors": [
    ("factor1", "low"|"medium"|"high", "textual reasoning"),
    ("factor2", "low"|"medium"|"high", "textual reasoning"),
    ...
  ],
  "prediction": "YES" or "NO",
  "confidence": number between 0 and 100
}
